docs.lead_paragraph: The Christmas Markets of Europe Any advice on Christmas markets in Europe? Are the marchés de Noël of Paris worth a visit? I have heard only Strasbourg is really worth visiting. Would Brussels be a better choice? Or should we stick to Christkindlmarkts in Munich and Berlin? -- R. Speer

docs.lead_paragraph: With food stamp use at record highs and climbing every month, a program once scorned as a failed welfare scheme now helps feed one in eight Americans and one in four children. It has grown so rapidly in places so diverse that it is becoming nearly as ordinary as the groceries it buys. More than 36 million people use inconspicuous plastic cards for staples like milk, bread and cheese, swiping them at counters in blighted cities and in suburbs pocked with foreclosure signs.

headline.main: Food Stamp Use Soars Across U.S., and Stigma Fades

docs.abstract: Article in series The Safety Net reports more than 36 million Americans now use food stamps and program is expanding at pace of about 20,000 people a day; Bush administration's move to erase program's stigma by calling food stamps nutritional aid rather than welfare helped clear way for numbers to soar during recession; use is greatest in areas of country where poverty runs deep, but growth has been especially swift in once-prosperous places hit hard by recession; food stamps reach about two-thirds of eligible people nationwide, and estimated 15 million to 16 million more people could benefit from program; graphs; maps; photos (L)
docs.snippet: A program once scorned as a failed welfare scheme now helps feed one in eight Americans and one in four children.
